comments.body: Double digit spawn rates for colonies seems kind of overwhelming for performance. The chest plate is definitely a nice idea though.
I don't like the cheat plate and colonies number (it should be some were around 7 to 5) but every thing else is nice maybe they do 1 to 2 hearts of damage

I like this idea, but I think that such a Yellow Allay should not highlight the chest, but take an item from there in 16 pieces and throw it to the player, since ordinary Blue Allays can also take and throw items.

I don't see much benefit in the usual chest highlighting, since if a player sorts their belongings, they already knows where the item they is looking for is, and if a player doesn't sort, then many chests will be highlighted at once and they will have to manually click all these chests anyway. 
It won't make sense to have a lot of Yellow Allays at once, because one will be enough to highlight everything around your storage, but if there are several such Allays that can take an item from a chest and bring it directly to the player, the player will be able to fill the inventory with the item they are looking for much faster.
it could help you loot structures by telling you where specific items are, but only if you have it yourself
Would you be able to breed it with normal allays as well as with yellow allays?
yesss bro thats relatable

Well, the point of the warden is kind to NOT be useful- at least they didn't want you to defeat it, they wanted to make a mob people would run from, not challenge. I don't think an ancient species will be given the ability for players to mount them. There's not really a point.

To move the Sniffer wherever you want, use Ancient Fruit with a fishing pole to craft Ancient Fruit On A Stick. Then, put a saddle onto the Sniffer and point your Ancient Fruit On a Stick in your preferred direction!

As someone who usually single plays, I'd rather see a large sniffer have major storage space for base moves, it should be slower than a donkey with basically no jump but a mobile base would play well and make the sniffer a means to be nomadic which is rather difficult without lots of leads, donkeys/lamas, or setting down a lot of rails.
you should be able to put chest on them

Five players?! Sniffers seem to be around the size of a panda or a polar bear. Five players wouldn't fit. Also, 1.20 is adding camels, which is the first mob to carry two people, so doing this in the same update would undermine the camel.
I think a new addition to the rideable mob would not work. Camel is already two-player ridable mob I think it would be great to see in the later game maybe in a future event.
I think that would be a very good idea. You can use an ancient fruit on a stick to mount it
Hello, that idea is good but it would be better only 3 players can ride the sniffer
Could they have a use beside ambience? Food is off the list, but being in jars as a light source isn't. Neither is having a special drop.

I seriously don't get why they scrapped fireflies altogether instead of just.. making it so frogs don't eat them. Because their concern was that in real life, fireflies are poisonous to frogs.

Minecraft has a good handful of useless ambient mobs. Bats, polar bears, and pandas do absolutely nothing but they add to the environment by simply existing. I think it'd be fine for fireflies to exist just for ambience.

As for items- I doubt they will add a firefly jar as a decoration block, purely because Mojang is pretty concerned with their effect on reality. Minecraft is a game played by children, so I imagine their concern would be that those children would try and make their own firefly jars.

Maybe they could drop something like glowstone dust, or another new ingredient that could be used to craft a new light fixture, something similar to the lanterns. Maybe you could use it to craft something like fairy lights, that would be hung up similarly to vines.

Ok but like getting rid of them so kids donâ€™t feed them to their frogs??? You can just make it so frogs donâ€™t eat them in the game or if they kept that itâ€™s the kids fault for killing their frog because they did something they saw in a video game
Yes!

I found it ridiculous that zombies and skeletons can kill endangered sea turtles and destroy their eggs by "teaching children" they can stomp on turtle eggs and kill them, but lets not let imaginary frogs eat imaginary fireflies.  I agree, all they had to do was not have the frogs eat them.  It makes no sense to take them out of the game when so many were looking forward to the magical ambience that they would have brought to the game-play.  When you can kill cats, dogs, and all the other wildlife..even your best friend if PVP is enabled, it makes no sense to me how anyone would complain about fireflies.  It's a game!

People need to understand that they likely weren't added because there was no time. The whole point was for how froglights would be made. The change meant fireflies weren't high priority anymore. There was a deadline for 1.19's release date. Maybe if Mojang had like another half a year to work on the update, they could've had the time needed to work on adding fireflies, because it wouldn't be easy but take several iterations/tests of how they would exist and function. There's many things to consider when adding new content. They're well aware of the demand and possible uses.
It's really not that much work like seriously

It would be nice to finally see fireflies in the game as little pixels that create atmosphere, perhaps in the fog. It would also be nice to have more flora (pumpkins, mushrooms and pale flowers) and fauna (evil rabbits with red eyes, hostile bats). A specific dungeon would really be the best.
Muddy pigs would be cool, we might need a use though, I voted.
I like that, is a good idea.
Great idea! Maybe if they are killed they could have a chance to drop mud balls for making mud bricks? Voted for sure!

(Adapting a post I was about to make):

This would be perfect for the Wild Update, especially considering the addition of mud. This iconic mob (one of the most iconic parts from its game) would be the perfect way to memorialize Minecraft Earth (and its version of mud, rip) and honor the developers who worked on the game's original content, all while still fitting the theme of the base game's next major update.

The Muddy Pig would be a resident of the swamp and mangrove swamp and would behave mostly like normal pigs. Their love of playing in mud could be useful for helping players identify the location of mud pockets or even just to help spot regions above water from a distance. In the first look at Minecraft Live, it appeared that players moved slower in mud just like soul sand. Maybe Muddy Pigs don't experience that, which could be an incentive to ride them in the swamps. They also just add some unique life; a mob that is clearly tied to its environment. 

If their drops were to be expanded on beyond those of a normal pig, perhaps they can drop the flower on their head or mud balls, the component for mud blocks and for making mud bricks.
